frameDefinitions: An Employer ends an employment relationship with an Employee.
Based on how many Individuals are employed, the Individuals as a whole are described with a Value (either a percentage or absolute number) representing the Employment of the Individuals.
An Employee voluntarily leaves the service of an Employer.
This frame contains nouns denoting a rank or level within an established hierarchy.
An Employee has a Position doing work in a particular Field, or doing work on a particular Task, for which an Employer gives Compensation to the Employee.
frameExamples: He <t>fired</t> me as annotator for being too slow.
<t>Unemployment</t> is down, salaries are up for US chemists.
Leah <t>quit</t> her job after one month because of an evil force.
Undocumented foreigners are <t>working</t> as  building contractors for Laing Builders.
listRoleDefinitions: The person who is let go by their <fen>Employer</fen>.
The person (or institution) that end an employment relationship with an <fen>Employee</fen>.
The label given to a particular type of employment.

The action that the <fen>Employee</fen> is relieved from doing for the <fen>Employer</fen>

.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when an <fen>Employer</fen> fires the <fen>Employee</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Employer</fen> fires the <fen>Employee</fen>.
The group of people whose employment status is considered.
The property of a group of <fen>Individuals</fen> describing how many of them are employed or unemployed.
The count or percentage of people among the group of <fen>Individuals</fen> that are of the specified employment status.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Value</fen> from the norm.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which <fen>Employment</fen> level of the <fen>Individuals</fen> has a specified <fen>Value</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Individuals</fen> under consideration reside.
The person who is obligated to perform some task in order to receive compensation.
The person (or institution) in whose employ  the <fen>Employee</fen> stood.
The Field that one works in.
The label given to a particular type of service that the employer quits.
This role identifies the Time when an <fen>Employee</fen> quits the employment of the <fen>Employer</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Employee</fen> quits the employment of the <fen>Employer</fen>.
The Rank itself, usually denoted by the noun.
An entity which holds a particular <fen>Rank</fen>.
The <fen>Employee</fen> is obligated to perform a <fen>Task</fen> in order to receive <fen>Compensation</fen>.
The <fen>Employer</fen> gives <fen>Compensation</fen> to an <fen>Employee</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place_of_employment</fen> of the <fen>Employee</fen>.
The label given to a particular type of employment.
The <fen>Employee</fen> is obligated to perform the <fen>Task</fen> to recieve <fen>Compensation</fen> from the <fen>Employer</fen> .
This role identifies the <fen>Field</fen> in which one works.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> period during which an <fen>Employee</fen>  works for an <fen>Employer</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Employee</fen> works.
listRoleExamples: <fex>I</fex> was just fired yesterday!
Dominic Mallozzi claims <fex>United Trust Bank</fex> fired him from a job at the bank's Palmer Township branch because he's HIV positive.
Doc Rivers was fired <fex>as coach of the Orlando Magic</fex>.
I was fired <fex>from training the new actors</fex>.
Guess who just got fired <fex>today</fex>!
The phone in his small apartment in the town of Milan rang and he dreaded it. He was going to be fired <fex>right there</fex>.
The high unemployment <fex>of the Romany population</fex> is one of the key issues, which need addressing.
The statistics are shocking: <fex><t>unemployment</t></fex> is 57 per cent.
While current unemployment <fex>of about 6%</fex> isn't high by historical standards, there's no denying this trend toward job exportation.
This leads to <fex>high</fex> joblessness in some pockets.
<fex>Last month's</fex> unemployment was 5.17 percent on a seasonally-adjusted basis.

A stadium is expected to cost $350 million, and financial woes caused by recession
and high joblessness <fex>in Oregon</fex> all but rule out public financing.
<fex>I</fex> just quit yesterday!
He replaces Michael Lawrie, 50, who quit <fex>IBM</fex> to run Siebel.
He might quit <fex>showbusiness</fex> for years.
I  quit <fex>as a professional player</fex>!
Guess who just quit <fex>today</fex>!
Actually Iquit <fex>in the lobby</fex> before I got to my office.
<fex>My Mom</fex> works for the Michigan Department of Agriculture.
My mom works <fex>for an Eye Doctor</fex>.
The undocumented foreigners were working <fex>at the organic farm</fex>.
Louise works <fex>as an engineer</fex>.
My dad works <fex>building houses.</fex>
Undocumented foreigners work <fex>in construction</fex> for years.

<fex>From 2000-2001</fex>, Mr. Eckhardt clerked for The Honorable Jerry A. Funk,
United States Bankruptcy Judge, Middle District of Florida.
Most people work <fex>in the city</fex>.
